comments:
build I20040330

- SWT in source
- run target
- sync and load incoming changes to SWT
- CVS complains that it can't delete resources
- the problem is that it can't delete the win32 dll (reasonable)
- the log file has the details about the affected file, but the Error Log only
shows the stack trace, which does not have this info; there was no + beside this
item

The log has:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 4 Apr 01, 2004 14:52:28.360
!MESSAGE Problems encountered while deleting resources.
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Problems encountered
while deleting resources.

!MESSAGE Problems encountered while deleting resources.
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 Apr 01, 2004 14:52:28.371
!MESSAGE Could not delete:
d:\eclipse-new\plugins\org.eclipse.swt.win32\os\win32\x86\swt-win32-3044.dll.

Cherie, please investigate by copying the stack into a .log file and importing 
it into the log view.

Cherie, although you fixed one problem, you did not address Nick's specific 
complaint.

Nick, the + was there all along.  You just had to widen the + column and you 
have seen this nested +.

Since there is no maximum depth limit on the log subentries, there is really 
no getting around possible hidden +'s.  That is why, as a visual indicator, we 
now bold all entries that have children.  This is the best visual cue we could 
come up with to tell you that this entry is expandable and if the + is not 
visible then you need to widen the column.

There was no hidden + and the item was not bold.
Other items in the log did have a visible + and were bold.

Created an attachment (id=9149)
Log view with revised reader

Hi Nick!

Here is how it looks on my screen with the revised LogReader.  The patch
allowed for the rest of the message to be visible in the message line and in
the message area of the Event Details Dialog.  

Wassim is right in that I had to expand the first column to see all the +'s
(hence the red rectangle), but the first two entries were bolded to indicate
they had subentries.  Does this not happen for you?

If the latest code from head does not strike your fancy, please let me know :)
